blocks.title: 1. What is Coffee?
blocks.content: Coffee is a beloved beverage prepared from roasted coffee beans, which are the seeds of berries from plants in the Coffea genus. Known for its rich flavor and caffeine content, coffee is one of the world's most popular drinks. While there are many brewing methods, in this course, we'll focus on the espresso method, which forms the basis for many popular coffee drinks. Coffee's journey from plant to cup is fascinating, involving cultivation, harvesting, processing, roasting, and finally, brewing. Each step influences the final taste, making coffee a complex and nuanced drink appreciated by millions worldwide.

blocks.title: 2. Espresso Basics
blocks.content: Espresso is a concentrated form of coffee served in small, strong shots and is the base for many coffee drinks. It's made by forcing pressurized hot water through very finely ground coffee beans using an espresso machine.

quiz.question: What machine is used to make espresso?

blocks.title: 3. Milk Steaming Techniques
blocks.content: Steaming milk is an essential skill for a barista. It involves using the steam wand on an espresso machine to heat and texture milk, creating microfoam for drinks like lattes and cappuccinos.

blocks.title: 4. Latte Art Basics
blocks.content: Latte art is the creative practice of pouring steamed milk into a shot of espresso in a way that creates patterns or designs on the surface of the resulting latte. It's not just about aesthetics; good latte art is often an indicator of well-prepared espresso and properly steamed milk. Common designs include hearts, rosettas, and tulips.
